concept.definition: Adenovirus, type 4 and type 7, live, oral

property.valueString: This vaccine is administered as 2 tablets.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a adenovirus vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This is the adjuvant that is packaged with H5N1 vaccine, adjuvanted

property.valueString: Note that this vaccine is different from CVX 132.

concept.definition: DTaP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
Historical diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis, poliovirus, Haemophilus b conjugate and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine.

property.valueString: This is not the same as CVX 146, Hexavalent vaccine.

property.valueString: This CVX was split off from CVX 102, to correctly identify the contents of the vaccine.

concept.definition: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
DTP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine

property.valueString: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .
Do not use this code. This product may be used for Hep A and other viral infections. The correct vaccine / CVX is 86 (IG).
This vaccine is not available in the US.

concept.definition: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule

property.valueString: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

concept.definition: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: Do NOT use this code. If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85. There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent (non-US)

property.valueString: e.g. Twinrix Junior available in Canada

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage

property.valueString: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). It requires Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for that vaccine.

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage

property.valueString: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

As of September 1999, a 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) was FDA approved for Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for the 2-dose. This code should be used for any use of standard adult formulation of hepatitis B vaccine.

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, dialysis patient dosage

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-D conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-OMP conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-T conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, conjugate unspecified formulation
Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and Hepatitis B vaccine

property.valueString: This vaccine may still be in use until the existing lots expire on 8/19/16.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HPV vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

property.valueString: Approved by FDA 2013, adjuvant is mixed at point of administration.

property.valueString: IIV3. This is one of two codes replacing CVX 15, which is being retired.
IIV3. This vaccine code is one of two which replace CVX 15, influenza, split virus.

concept.definition: influenza virus vaccine, split virus (incl. purified surface antigen)-retired CODE

property.valueString: This code is being retired. It will still be found in older immunization records. It included both preservative free and non-preservative free.

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Influenza vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: Japanese Encephalitis vaccine for intramuscular administration

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a JE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.

concept.definition: meningococcal B vaccine, recombinant, OMV, adjuvanted
Meningococcal Groups C and Y and Haemophilus b Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine
Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)

property.valueString: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

concept.definition: meningococcal oligosaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4O)
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4P)
meningococcal vaccine of unknown formulation and unknown serogroups

property.valueString: This CVX is intended for use when any one of the meningococcal vaccines is recorded and there is no information about which serogroups are protected against. This code should not be used when a newly administered immunization is recorded.

concept.definition: measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine

property.valueString: This code is used whenever the actual formulation is not determined or when aggregating all Novel H1N1 Influenza-09 immunizations for reporting to CRA. It should not be used for seasonal influenza vaccine that is not otherwise specified. (NOS)

concept.definition: Novel Influenza-H1N1-09, live virus for nasal administration

property.valueString: This is the OPV that was used in the US

concept.definition: Non-US monovalent oral polio vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories. It is composed of either Type 1, Type 2 or Type 3 oral polio vaccine.

concept.definition: Non-US bivalent oral polio vaccine (types 1 and 3)

property.valueString: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories.
This code represents an oral polio vaccine where the specific formulation is unknown.
This CVX should only be used for historical records where the formulation of pneumococcal conjugate vaccine is not known.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a pneumococcal vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a polio vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: varicella zoster immune globulin (Investigational New Drug)

property.valueString: This is the YF vaccine that has been available in the US for years. It is stabilized with sorbitol and gelatin.
This vaccine is stabilized with sorbitol and lactose and has been used outside the US for some time. It will be made available in the US.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a zoster vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.
Code 99 will not be used in this table to avoid confusion with code 999.
This CVX code has little utility and should rarely be used.
